sentences.en: He addressed the others with extravagant gestures, blinking his inflamed eyelids.
sentences.cn: 他手舞足蹈地对大家讲着, 眨着红肿眼皮.

sentences.en: He has got an inflamed throat , so his voice sounds rough.
sentences.cn: 他嗓子发炎了, 说话声音发哑.

sentences.en: He is suffering from an inflamed throat.
sentences.cn: 他正承受着咽喉发炎之苦.

sentences.en: Her eyes were sore and inflamed.
Her leniency had, in a way, inflamed his regard.
sentences.cn: 在一定程度上, 她的宽容态度也煽起了他的爱慕之情.

sentences.en: His comments have inflamed teachers all over the country.
sentences.cn: 他的评论激怒了全国教师。

sentences.en: It was fretted and over - stimulated and inflamed and fored into the nationalist mould.
sentences.cn: 它被推波助澜,被过度刺激,被煽动和强迫纳入民族主义的模型.

sentences.en: Symptoms include red, itchy and inflamed skin.
sentences.cn: 症状包括皮肤发红、发痒、发炎。

sentences.en: The drink inflamed their eyes and loosened their tongues.
sentences.cn: 喝着喝着,大家的眼睛红起来,嘴不再受管辖.

sentences.en: The hills were inflamed with autumnal tints.
The shooting has only inflamed passions further.
sentences.cn: 枪击事件无疑是火上浇油。

sentences.en: The smoke had inflamed the fireman's eyes.
sentences.cn: 烟把消防队员的眼睛熏红了.

words.tran_cn: [病理] 炎症；[医] 发炎；燃烧；发火
使发炎（inflame的过去分词）；使燃烧；使火红；激起

trans.tran_en: a part of your body that is inflamed is red and swollen, because it is injured or infected

trans.tran_cn: （使）变红，发怒，过热( inflame的过去式和过去分词 )
